poem:
Lasooni Fish

In Mayfair's heart, the fish  
tikka, a dance of tradition—  
roasted garlic whispers  
through smoky airs,  
wrapped in red tandoori dreams,  
a celebration of Punjab's  
undivided taste—  
paired with cumin's cool embrace,  
a raita's gentle touch,  
binding histories  
in each bite, a feast  
of eons—love's  
language on a plate.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Karam Sethi’s recipe for garlic fish tikka with cumin raita Today’s fish tikka is one of the standout dishes on the menu of our new restaurant, Ambassadors Clubhouse in Mayfair, where we celebrate the rich culinary traditions of undivided Punjab. Lasooni essentially means garlic, which here in roasted form joins forces with a traditional red tandoori marinade to give the fish a smoky, aromatic coating. It’s complemented by a side of refreshing, cumin-spiked raita. Lasooni". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Karam Sethi’s recipe for garlic fish tikka with cumin raita Today’s fish tikka is one of the standout dishes on the menu of our new restaurant, Ambassadors Clubhouse in Mayfair, where we celebrate the rich culinary traditions of undivided Punjab. Lasooni essentially means garlic, which here in roasted form joins forces with a traditional red tandoori marinade to give the fish a smoky, aromatic coating. It’s complemented by a side of refreshing, cumin-spiked raita. Lasooni
